problem: Find the quotient when $x^9 + 1$ is divided by $x - 1.$
solution:
We can perform long division.  We can also write
\begin{align*}
\frac{x^9 + 1}{x - 1} &= \frac{(x^9 - 1) + 2}{x - 1} \\
&= \frac{x^9 - 1}{x - 1} + \frac{2}{x - 1} \\
&= x^8 + x^7 + x^6 + x^5 + x^4 + x^3 + x^2 + x + 1 + \frac{2}{x - 1}.
\end{align*}Thus, the quotient is $\boxed{x^8 + x^7 + x^6 + x^5 + x^4 + x^3 + x^2 + x + 1}.$
model_solution:
Step 1: We can use polynomial long division to find the quotient. Divide $x^9 + 1$ by $x - 1$.

$\require{enclose} \begin{array}{rll} x^8 + x^7 + x^6 + x^5 + x^4 + x^3 + x^2 + x + 1 \\[-3pt] x - 1 \enclose{longdiv}{x^9 + 0x^8 + 0x^7 + 0x^6 + 0x^5 + 0x^4 + 0x^3 + 0x^2 + 0x + 1}\kern-.2ex \\[-3pt] \underline{-(x^9 - x^8)} \\[-3pt] x^8 + x^7 + x^6 + x^5 + x^4 + x^3 + x^2 + x + 1 \\[-3pt] \end{array}$
Step 2: $\require{enclose} \begin{array}{rll} x^8 + x^7 + x^6 + x^5 + x^4 + x^3 + x^2 + x + 1 \\[-3pt] x - 1 \enclose{longdiv}{x^9 + 0x^8 + 0x^7 + 0x^6 + 0x^5 + 0x^4 + 0x^3 + 0x^2 + 0x + 1}\kern-.2ex \\[-3pt] \underline{-(x^9 - x^8)} \\[-3pt] x^8 + x^7 + x^6 + x^5 + x^4 + x^3 + x^2 + x + 1 \\[-3pt] \underline{-(-x^8 - x^7 - x^6 - x^5 - x^4 - x^3 - x^2 - x - 1)} \\[-3pt] \end{array}$
$\require{enclose} \begin{array}{rll} x^8 + x^7 + x^6 + x^5 + x^4 + x^3 + x^2 + x + 1 \\[-3pt] x - 1 \enclose{longdiv}{x^9 + 0x^8 + 0x^7 + 0x^6 + 0x^5 + 0x^4 + 0x^3 + 0x^2 + 0x + 1}\kern-.2ex \\[-3pt] \underline{-(x^9 - x^8)} \\[-3pt] x^8 + x^7 + x^6 + x^5 + x^4 + x^3 + x^2 + x + 1 \\[-3pt] \underline{-(-x^8 - x^7 - x^6 - x^5 - x^4 - x^3 - x^2 - x - 1)} \\[-3pt] x^8 + x^7 + x^6 + x^5 + x^4 + x^3 + x^2 + x
$\require{enclose} \begin{array}{rll} x^8 + x^7 + x^6 + x^5 + x^4 + x^3 + x^2 + x + 1 \\[-3pt] x - 1 \enclose{longdiv}{x^9 + 0x^8 + 0x^7 + 0x^6 + 0x^5 + 0x^4 + 0x^3 + 0x^2 + 0x + 1}\kern-.2ex \\[-3pt] \underline{-(x^9 - x^8)} \\[-3pt] x^8 + x^7 + x^6 + x^5 + x^4 + x^3 + x^2 + x + 1 \\[-3pt] \underline{-(-x^8 - x^7 - x^6 - x^5 - x^4 - x^3 - x^2 - x - 1)} \\[-3pt] x^8 + x^7 + x^6 + x^5 + x^4 + x^3 + x^2 + x
